\section{Constructions}

\subsection{Terminal Object}
A terminal object $c\in\mathrm{ob}_C$ is an object such that for all
$c'\in\mathrm{ob}_C$, there exists a unique morphism $f:c'\to c$
e.g. In the category Set, the terminal objects are the singleton sets, whose only
incoming arrow from any category is the constant function.

\subsubsection*{As the limit of the empty diagram}
Notice the absense of $\alpha$ arrows.
% https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsMixbMCwwLCJjIl0sWzAsMiwiYyciXSxbMSwwLCJoIiwyLHsic3R5bGUiOnsiYm9keSI6eyJuYW1lIjoiZGFzaGVkIn19fV1d
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	c \\
	\\
	{c'}
	\arrow["h"', dashed, from=3-1, to=1-1]
\end{tikzcd}\]

\subsection{Product}
In a category $C$, the cartesian product of $2$ objects $a,\ b$ is another
object $a\times b$ with morphisms $\mathrm{fst}: a\times b \to a,
\ \mathrm{snd}: a\times b \to b$ such that, for any other object $c$ with the
same property there exist a unique $f:c \to a\times b$ such that the following
diagram commutes
% https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsNCxbMSwwLCJhXFx0aW1lcyBiIl0sWzAsMSwiYSJdLFsyLDEsImIiXSxbMSwyLCJjIl0sWzAsMSwiXFxtYXRocm17ZnN0fSIsMl0sWzAsMiwiXFxtYXRocm17c25kfSJdLFszLDAsImYiLDIseyJzdHlsZSI6eyJib2R5Ijp7Im5hbWUiOiJkYXNoZWQifX19XSxbMywxLCJnIl0sWzMsMiwiaCIsMl1d
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	& {a\times b} \\
	a && b \\
	& c
	\arrow["{\mathrm{fst}}"', from=1-2, to=2-1]
	\arrow["{\mathrm{snd}}", from=1-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["f"', dashed, from=3-2, to=1-2]
	\arrow["g", from=3-2, to=2-1]
	\arrow["h"', from=3-2, to=2-3]
\end{tikzcd}\]

e.g.
Consider the following preorder
% https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsNixbMSwyLCI2Il0sWzAsMiwiMyJdLFsxLDEsIjUiXSxbMSwwLCI0Il0sWzAsMSwiMiJdLFswLDAsIjEiXSxbMCwxLCJnIl0sWzAsMiwiZiIsMl0sWzIsMywiYyIsMl0sWzEsNCwiZSJdLFs0LDUsImIiXSxbMyw1LCJhIiwyXSxbNCwyLCJkIl1d
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	1 & 4 \\
	2 & 5 \\
	3 & 6
	\arrow["g", from=3-2, to=3-1]
	\arrow["f"', from=3-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["c"', from=2-2, to=1-2]
	\arrow["e", from=3-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["b", from=2-1, to=1-1]
	\arrow["a"', from=1-2, to=1-1]
	\arrow["d", from=2-1, to=2-2]
\end{tikzcd}\]
The product candidates for $2\times 4$ are $2$ with $\mathrm{id}_2 : 2\to 2$
and $d\circ c:2\to 4$, $3$ with $e: 3\to 2$ and $c\circ d\circ e: 3\to 4$,
and $6$ with $e \circ g: 6\to 2$ and $c\circ f$. The product $2\times 4$
corresponds then to the object $2$. The product in a preorder corresponds to the
meet operation $\land$ or infimum.
\parencite{fong:7sketches}

\subsubsection*{As a terminal morphism from the diagonal functor}
% https://q.uiver.app/?
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	C & {C\times C} \\
	{a\times b} & {\Delta(a\times b)} & {(a,b)} \\
	{c'} & {\Delta(c')}
	\arrow["{(\mathrm{fst},\mathrm{snd})}", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["{f'}"', from=3-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow[""{name=0, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "{\Delta(h)}", dashed, from=3-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow[""{name=1, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "h", dashed, from=3-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=3-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow["\Delta"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, shorten <=8pt, shorten >=25pt, dotted, from=1, to=0]
\end{tikzcd}\]

\subsubsection*{As the limit of a discrete diagram}
% https://q.uiver.app/?
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	& {\underline{2}} && C \\
	&&& {a\times b} \\
	1 & 2 & a && b \\
	&&& c
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,41;green,163;blue,41}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=3-1, to=3-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,41;green,163;blue,41}, curve={height=12pt}, dotted, from=3-2, to=3-5]
	\arrow["{\mathrm{fst}}"{description}, from=2-4, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{\mathrm{snd}}"{description}, from=2-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=3-1, to=2-4]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=3-2, to=2-4]
	\arrow["h"{description}, dashed, from=4-4, to=2-4]
	\arrow["{\alpha_a}"{description}, from=4-4, to=3-3]
	\arrow["{\alpha_b}"{description}, from=4-4, to=3-5]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dotted, from=3-1, to=4-4]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dotted, from=3-2, to=4-4]
	\arrow["J"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,41;green,163;blue,41}, from=1-2, to=1-4]
	\arrow["{\Delta c}"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=24pt}, from=1-2, to=1-4]
	\arrow["{\Delta(a\times b)}"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-24pt}, from=1-2, to=1-4]
\end{tikzcd}\]

\subsection{Exponential}
\subsubsection*{As a terminal morphism from a product}
% https://q.uiver.app/?
\[\begin{tikzcd}
	C & C \\
	{B^A} & {B^A\times A} & B \\
	Z & {Z\times A}
	\arrow[""{name=0, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "h", dashed, from=3-1, to=2-1]
	\arrow["{\mathrm{eval}}", from=2-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow["g"', from=3-2, to=2-3]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, dotted, from=3-1, to=3-2]
	\arrow[""{name=1, anchor=center, inner sep=0}, "{h\times\mathrm{id}_A}", dashed, from=3-2, to=2-2]
	\arrow["{\_\times A}"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, from=1-1, to=1-2]
	\arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, shorten <=7pt, shorten >=30pt, dotted, from=0, to=1]
\end{tikzcd}\]
